result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pamela D Kelly

records.addlTxt: Received and filed: STATE'S MOTION IN LIMINE
Received and filed: STATE'S Requested Jury Instructions

Defendant Pamela D Kelly in court.  Attorney Imran Kurter in court for Pamela D Kelly.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a calendar call. DEFENDANT APPEARS. Court vacates the stayed warrant. Discussion held. Defense still needs discovery. Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Case adjourned.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Pamela D Kelly not in court.  Attorney Imran Kurter in court for Pamela D Kelly.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing off the record due to no court reporter availability. Case scheduled for status conference. Defendant failing to appear. Defense counsel requests that the Court impose and stay a warrant. State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.
Calendar call scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Pamela D Kelly in court with attorney Imran Kurter.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status of Counsel held.  Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests additional status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Pamela D Kelly in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. 
ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD.  Case calendared for a pretrial Conference.
Court advised defendant the State Public Defender Office need additional time to appoint counsel.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DH.

Defendant Pamela D Kelly in court.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/01/2022@1:30p
